00:00:02:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:02:030000.Dialogue: Hey, do me a favor and take table seven.

00:00:05:020000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:00:05:020000.Dialogue: You mean the one with my 118-pound rock-hard stud of a fiancé who's prone to canker sores and pinkeye?

00:00:12:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:12:070000.Dialogue: Nah, I prefer to look at it as the one with my ex-boyfriend and his gorgeous, successful and sophisticated girlfriend, who makes me feel like a toothless Okie.

00:00:22:040000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:00:22:040000.Dialogue: Do you want me to spill hot soup on her?

00:00:25:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:25:110000.Dialogue: Oh, please-- you're not that kind of person.

00:00:27:150000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:00:27:150000.Dialogue: I know. But if she orders something low-fat I'll totally give her the full-fat version.

00:00:39:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:39:140000.Dialogue: D-Dear Lord! Have you been drinking it?

00:00:45:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:45:210000.Dialogue: Well, that's it then. I'm dead.

00:00:51:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:51:230000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, do I really need to connect the dots for you? The backwash into this glass is every pathogen that calls your mouth home, sweet home. Not to mention the visitors who arrive on the dancing tongue of your subtropical girlfriend.

00:01:05:070000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:05:070000.Dialogue: Hey! That's my sister and my country you're talking about. Leonard may have defiled one, but I won't have you talking smack about the other.

00:01:15:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:15:070000.Dialogue: Yes, I'd like a seven-day course of penicillin, some, uh, syrup of ipecac-- to induce vomiting-- and a mint.

00:01:25:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:25:130000.Dialogue: He drank from Leonard's glass-- the words they'll be carving into my tombstone.

00:02:08:160000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:02:08:160000.Dialogue: All right. Here you go. Two lemonades, one iced tea and a root beer for Priya.

00:02:20:050000.Speaker: Priya
00:02:20:050000.Dialogue: Thank you. Hey, have you and Howard started planning your wedding yet?

00:02:25:120000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:02:25:120000.Dialogue: Yeah. We're thinking of having it on a cliff overlooking the ocean.

00:02:29:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:29:040000.Dialogue: Nothing soothes those pre-wedding jitters like the thought of falling and drowning.

00:02:35:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:35:020000.Dialogue: What did your mother say when you told her you were getting married?

00:02:37:230000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:02:37:230000.Dialogue: He hasn't told her yet. He's waiting for the right time.

00:02:40:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:40:160000.Dialogue: I was thinking of weaving it into her eulogy.

00:02:44:100000.Speaker: Priya
00:02:44:100000.Dialogue: Howard, you've got to tell your mother.

00:02:47:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:47:100000.Dialogue: Hey, have you told your parents you're dating this short glass of skim milk here?

00:02:52:090000.Speaker: Priya
00:02:52:090000.Dialogue: Uh... that's different. First of all, we're not engaged; and second, Indian parents are very protective of their children.

00:03:00:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:00:050000.Dialogue: Right, right, whereas Jewish mothers take a casual, la-di-da approach to their sons.

00:03:08:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:08:050000.Dialogue: I gargled with tequila and may have swallowed a teeny bit.

00:03:21:070000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:21:070000.Dialogue: Ooh, fire demon. Sheldon's turning up the heat...

00:03:29:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:29:210000.Dialogue: Check it! Howard pulls one out from under the bridge. Nice!

00:03:36:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:36:140000.Dialogue: Oh, yeah, she's got puddles in all the right places.

00:03:40:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:40:190000.Dialogue: Could you please play the game without commenting on every card?

00:03:53:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:53:090000.Dialogue: I'm taking a stroll and I'm sporting wood.

00:04:05:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:05:050000.Dialogue: Bernadette and my mother are having a get-to-know-you lunch at the Old Town Deli.

00:04:09:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:09:220000.Dialogue: Hope so. Of course, if history is any indication, my mother will swallow her whole and spit out her bones like an owl.

00:04:22:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:22:100000.Dialogue: Not yet. One goose step at a time.

00:04:47:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:47:130000.Dialogue: WOLOWITZ: Ma, I'm home! Where are you?

00:04:52:020000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:04:52:020000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: I'm in the toilet!

00:04:57:150000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:04:57:150000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: Too soon to say! I'm not done yet!

00:05:03:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:03:060000.Dialogue: No, I mean lunch, today, with Bernadette!

00:05:05:230000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:05:05:230000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: Oh! I had a pastrami sandwich. She had eggplant lasagna. Like that's what a person orders in a Jewish deli.

00:05:16:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:16:020000.Dialogue: Besides food, did you get along? Did you talk?

00:05:19:120000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:05:19:120000.Dialogue: Oh, sure! Did you know she's going to school to become a microbiologist?!

00:05:30:070000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:05:30:070000.Dialogue: I bet she did and you didn't listen!

00:05:35:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:35:070000.Dialogue: Yeah, that's probably it. So, what do you think? Do you like her? She's great, huh?

00:05:39:180000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:05:39:180000.Dialogue: She's a lovely girl! Cute as a button!

00:05:42:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:42:210000.Dialogue: That's good to hear, 'cause I've got some news.

00:05:47:040000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:05:47:040000.Dialogue: I hope it's good news, because I've got nothing but disappointment in here!

00:06:00:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:00:140000.Dialogue: Bernadette and I are getting married.

00:06:08:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:08:100000.Dialogue: Ma? You too busy bearing down?

00:06:15:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:15:100000.Dialogue: Ma? Oh, my God, Ma? Ma? Ma? Stand back, I'm gonna break the door down!

00:06:31:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:31:100000.Dialogue: Son of a bitch! Ma, help!

00:06:39:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:39:150000.Dialogue: Haven't seen you in a while. How's it going?

00:06:42:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:42:050000.Dialogue: Oh, other than waiting out the exponential growth period of the virulent organisms trooping through my microvilli into my circulatory system-- hunky-dory. (giggles)

00:07:00:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:00:010000.Dialogue: I don't know, maybe, I have no idea what you said.

00:07:03:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:03:180000.Dialogue: So your mirth is merely a discharge of nervous energy with no semantic content at all?

00:07:12:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:12:150000.Dialogue: Is there a station coming up where I can board your giggling train of thought?

00:07:18:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:18:150000.Dialogue: It's not a big deal, Sheldon. It's just, ever since Leonard's been dating Raj's sister, I've had to keep my distance. I don't get to hear all your jibber-jabber.

00:07:30:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:30:220000.Dialogue: What are you doing at work these days?

00:07:32:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:32:210000.Dialogue: Oh, I'm working on time-dependent backgrounds in string theory, specifically quantum field theory in "d-dimensional" de Sitter space.

00:07:42:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:42:180000.Dialogue: Okay, come on, even you have to admit that's jibber-jabber.

00:07:47:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:47:120000.Dialogue: Interesting, do you know where the phrase "jibber-jabber" comes from?

00:07:51:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:51:070000.Dialogue: Oh, my God, you're about to jibber-jabber about jibber-jabber.

00:07:59:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:59:040000.Dialogue: Howard and his mother are at the hospital. - Come on, we gotta go.

00:08:02:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:02:200000.Dialogue: I don't know, I just got a text. Come on, hurry.

00:08:10:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:10:170000.Dialogue: To a hospital?! Full of sick people?!

00:08:17:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:17:140000.Dialogue: Okay, well, your friend and his mother are there, we're going.

00:08:22:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:22:110000.Dialogue: Oh, don't tell me you're afraid of germs.

00:08:24:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:24:190000.Dialogue: Not all germs. Just the ones that will kill me. It's the same way I'm not afraid of all steak knives-- just the ones that might be plunged in my thorax.

00:08:35:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:35:230000.Dialogue: Fine, I'll tell Howard you didn't come because you're more concerned about your own well-being than his.

00:08:41:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:41:010000.Dialogue: I would think he would know that.

00:08:45:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:45:130000.Dialogue: Okay, you know what? You are unbelievable. You buy all these superhero T-shirts, but when it's time for you to step up and do the right thing, you just hide in the laundry room.

00:08:55:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:55:030000.Dialogue: Fine, I'll go. Just for the record, my Aunt Ruth died in a hospital. She went in to visit my Uncle Roger, caught something and bit the dust a week later. The two of them now share a coffee can on my mother's mantel.

00:09:16:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:16:020000.Dialogue: So I knocked down the bathroom door, picked up my poor unconscious mother, carried her to the car, and drove like a madman to the emergency room.

00:09:25:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:25:030000.Dialogue: No, I did what any son would do.

00:09:27:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:27:090000.Dialogue: Hang on a second-- you picked up your mother?

00:09:32:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:32:040000.Dialogue: Her own legs are barely able to do that.

00:09:37:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:37:010000.Dialogue: I was filled with adrenaline. It happens to be how women lift cars off babies.

00:09:41:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:41:190000.Dialogue: Yeah, I'm saying, it'd be easier to lift a car.

00:09:46:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:46:060000.Dialogue: What can I tell you? After I found the courage to put her pants back on, I was unstoppable.

00:09:54:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:54:150000.Dialogue: They're running tests-- I don't know. It may have been a heart attack or heart-attack-like event.

00:10:01:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:01:090000.Dialogue: A heart-attack-like event is an event that's like a heart attack.

00:10:09:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:09:010000.Dialogue: Regardless, coronary problems are eminently treatable. What's more likely going to kill Howard's mother are the antibiotic-resistant super-bugs festering in every nook and cranny of this hospital.

00:10:27:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:27:130000.Dialogue: I'll sit over there-- it looks cleaner.

00:10:33:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:33:010000.Dialogue: Is there a history of heart disease in your family?

00:10:35:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:35:080000.Dialogue: My family is the history of heart disease. There's a cave painting in France of one of my ancestors doing this:

00:10:48:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:48:220000.Dialogue: Well, maybe. Mom also had just gotten some news that might have upset her.

00:10:56:100000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:10:56:100000.Dialogue: Come on, Howard, I'm going to be your wife. You can share anything with me.

00:11:06:230000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:11:06:230000.Dialogue: You told her we were going to get married and she had a heart attack?

00:11:14:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:14:140000.Dialogue: How else is she supposed to take it?

00:11:16:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:16:140000.Dialogue: What you've got to keep in mind is that ever since my dad left, I've been the whole world to my mother. I mean, she'd be threatened by any woman who can give me what she can't.

00:11:35:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:35:030000.Dialogue: Well, when you say it like that you make it sound creepy.

00:11:40:070000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:11:40:070000.Dialogue: Howard's mother had a heart attack because I have sex with him and she can't.

00:11:51:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:51:090000.Dialogue: I'll give you $1,000 if you'll drive me home.

00:11:57:040000.Speaker: Priya
00:11:57:040000.Dialogue: Nice of you to come for Howard.

00:11:59:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:59:070000.Dialogue: Well, he's my friend. It's what you do.

00:12:04:120000.Speaker: Priya
00:12:04:120000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, did I miss something?

00:12:07:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:07:030000.Dialogue: It's just so weird. Howard Wolowitz is my friend. You know, once he tried to stick his tongue down my throat and I broke his nose.

00:12:14:220000.Speaker: Priya
00:12:14:220000.Dialogue: That's a little easier to believe than he's your friend.

00:12:20:160000.Speaker: Priya
00:12:20:160000.Dialogue: You know, my brother had a group of friends like this in India. They dressed up in leotards and goggles and called themselves the New Delhi Power Rangers.

00:12:28:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:28:210000.Dialogue: You mean when he was little.

00:12:31:050000.Speaker: Priya
00:12:31:050000.Dialogue: Not as little as you'd want him to be.

00:12:36:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:36:090000.Dialogue: You know, this stuff is horrible. You want to see if we can find the cafeteria and get real coffee?

00:12:39:190000.Speaker: Priya
00:12:39:190000.Dialogue: Sure. We're going to the cafeteria to get some coffee. You want anything?

00:12:43:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:43:200000.Dialogue: I'm fine. That's nice that they're getting along.

00:12:48:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:48:040000.Dialogue: Your girlfriend and your ex-girlfriend are hanging out together? Oh, yeah, that can only be good for you.

00:12:58:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:58:110000.Dialogue: One of them broke up with you. Do you really want her telling the other one why?

00:13:02:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:02:090000.Dialogue: I don't care. I don't have anything to hide.

00:13:06:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:06:090000.Dialogue: Good, good. Then you have nothing to worry about.

00:13:10:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:10:120000.Dialogue: No, I do not. You are a mean little man.

00:13:19:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:19:190000.Dialogue: You'd think it'd be because my parents didn't love me, but actually they loved me a great deal.

00:13:25:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:25:090000.Dialogue: Bernie, it's not you. She's just set in her ways.

00:13:29:180000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:13:29:180000.Dialogue: How can we be together if the thought of us getting married might kill your mother?

00:13:33:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:33:210000.Dialogue: It's the circle of life, sweetie.

00:13:39:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:39:010000.Dialogue: One day our son will marry someone and it will kill you.

00:13:45:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:45:160000.Dialogue: Howard, I have to go to the bathroom and no one will take me home.

00:13:49:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:49:010000.Dialogue: What's wrong with the bathroom here?

00:13:50:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:50:210000.Dialogue: Pneumococcus, streptococcus, staphylococcus and other assorted coccuses.

00:13:56:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:56:140000.Dialogue: Sheldon, my mother is on her deathbed and my fiancée is grief-stricken over putting her there. I'm not taking you home.

00:14:03:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:03:050000.Dialogue: Will you at least go with me to the restroom here, so you can open the door and flush the urinal?

00:14:10:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:10:070000.Dialogue: This might be a good time to point out, Howard, that friendship requires a certain give and take.

00:14:23:180000.Speaker: Doctor
00:14:23:180000.Dialogue: Mr. Wolowitz? - Is she okay? - It wasn't a heart attack. She's awake, she's resting comfortably-- we're still running tests.

00:14:32:230000.Speaker: Doctor
00:14:32:230000.Dialogue: Actually, she said, and I quote, she'd "like to see the little Catholic girl first."

00:14:42:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:42:100000.Dialogue: Jews have been asking that for centuries. There's no real good answer.

00:14:51:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:51:020000.Dialogue: Don't worry, you'll be fine. Let's just hide Mr. Cross. If it touches her, it burns.

00:15:00:120000.Speaker: Doctor
00:15:00:120000.Dialogue: You brought a Catholic girl home to your mother?

00:15:03:230000.Speaker: Doctor
00:15:03:230000.Dialogue: Why don't I write you a prescription for Xanax.

00:15:11:230000.Scene: Outside the hospital washroom. A man enters. 339
00:15:11:230000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:15:13:000000.Scene: Outside the hospital washroom. A man enters. 339

00:15:27:020000.Scene: Outside the hospital washroom. A man enters. 339
00:15:27:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:27:020000.Dialogue: Oh, what fresh hell is this?

00:15:30:010000.Scene: Outside the hospital washroom. A man enters. 339
00:15:30:010000.Speaker: Doctor
00:15:30:010000.Dialogue: Wait, you can't leave here, you've been exposed.

00:15:34:190000.Scene: Outside the hospital washroom. A man enters. 339
00:15:34:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:34:190000.Dialogue: No, I haven't. It's all good.

00:15:41:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:41:200000.Dialogue: You want to talk about crazy mothers, Leonard's mom wouldn't give him any sort of approval growing up.

00:15:48:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:48:220000.Dialogue: It makes him desperate to please women. That's why the foreplay goes on and on.

00:15:55:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:55:170000.Dialogue: It's like he's trying to win a prize. A word of advice-- don't doze off. You will never hear the end of it.

00:16:08:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:08:080000.Dialogue: There are a couple of things I did with Penny that might be a little silly, but...

00:16:14:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:14:020000.Dialogue: Every once in a while, before we'd go to bed, I'd put on a little show for her.

00:16:24:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:24:110000.Dialogue: Well, you know, the way I took my clothes off.

00:16:31:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:31:190000.Dialogue: I'd look pretty stupid if there was no music.

00:16:39:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:39:010000.Dialogue: I wasn't swinging around a pole.

00:16:46:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:46:140000.Dialogue: There was one time I put body glitter on.

00:16:50:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:16:50:140000.Dialogue: Well, I don't think you have to worry about Penny telling my sister that.

00:16:56:000000.Speaker: Raj
00:16:56:000000.Dialogue: Your big problem is me telling her.

00:17:00:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:00:230000.Dialogue: You really are a mean little man.

00:17:08:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:08:160000.Dialogue: Hey, what took you guys so long?

00:17:14:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:14:040000.Dialogue: We were just comparing notes about how you are in the sack.

00:17:26:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:26:010000.Dialogue: It doesn't matter. I'm the king of foreplay.

00:17:41:180000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:17:41:180000.Dialogue: Your mother just taught it to me. She thinks she got food poisoning from that deli and she just wanted to make sure I was okay.

00:17:50:070000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:17:50:070000.Dialogue: No, because I'm engaged to a putz.

00:17:55:160000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:17:55:160000.Dialogue: You let me believe I was the reason she had a heart attack.

00:17:58:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:58:210000.Dialogue: Well, based on the available evid--

00:18:00:050000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:18:00:050000.Dialogue: Shut up! She said I'm a wonderful girl and that you're lucky to have me.

00:18:06:140000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:18:06:140000.Dialogue: (like Mrs. Wolowitz): To the toilet! Is that okay with you?!

00:18:14:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:14:200000.Dialogue: Is it just me, or does she sound sexy when she's angry?

00:18:27:120000.Scene: A hospital room. The guys except for Sheldon are in Hazmat suits.
00:18:27:120000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:18:33:100000.Scene: A hospital room. The guys except for Sheldon are in Hazmat suits.
00:18:33:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:33:100000.Dialogue: He takes the elf from off the shelf.

00:18:37:040000.Scene: A hospital room. The guys except for Sheldon are in Hazmat suits.
00:18:37:040000.Speaker: Leonard

00:18:39:180000.Scene: A hospital room. The guys except for Sheldon are in Hazmat suits.
00:18:39:180000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:39:180000.Dialogue: Hell Hounds-- who let the Satanic dogs out? Who? Who-who?

00:18:46:200000.Scene: A hospital room. The guys except for Sheldon are in Hazmat suits.
00:18:46:200000.Speaker: Howard

00:18:48:100000.Scene: A hospital room. The guys except for Sheldon are in Hazmat suits.
00:18:48:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:48:100000.Dialogue: I got a colossal serpent right here.

00:18:53:220000.Scene: A hospital room. The guys except for Sheldon are in Hazmat suits.
00:18:53:220000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:18:55:050000.Scene: A hospital room. The guys except for Sheldon are in Hazmat suits.
00:18:55:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:55:050000.Dialogue: Sorry, I'm just trying to cheer my buddy up.

00:18:58:220000.Scene: A hospital room. The guys except for Sheldon are in Hazmat suits.
00:18:58:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:58:220000.Dialogue: Rotting Zombie. Sheldon's new Facebook photo.

00:19:07:180000.Scene: A hospital room. The guys except for Sheldon are in Hazmat suits.
00:19:07:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:07:180000.Dialogue: Zandor, Wizard of the North. Ha! I win.

00:19:12:070000.Scene: A hospital room. The guys except for Sheldon are in Hazmat suits.
00:19:12:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:12:070000.Dialogue: If you skip the part about being under a two-week quarantine because you were exposed to a deadly disease-- absolutely.
